headline: Equinix, Canada's CPPIB near deal to buy Nordic data-center operator atNorth, Bloomberg News reports
summary: Equinix and Canada Pension Plan Investment Board are ‌close to reaching a deal ‌to acquire atNorth, a pan-Nordic data-center operator backed ​by Partners Group, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter. The deal, which may be ‌announced in the ⁠coming days, could value atNorth at about $4 billion including debt, ⁠according to the report. CPPIB and Partners Group declined Reuters requests for ​comment, while ​Equinix did not ​immediately respond.

thumbnail.caption: The logo of Equinix is pictured at the entrance of a data center in Pantin
